intro: Dichaetophora campestris, commonly known as the field bluet, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, blue-violet flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as fields and roadsides. It has slender stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Dichaetophora campestris is often found in temperate regions of Europe and Asia.
